charset.alternative: Use an HTTP Content-Type header on the linked resource instead.

shape.alternative: Use area instead of a for image maps.

methods.alternative: Use the HTTP OPTIONS feature instead.

urn.alternative: Specify the preferred persistent identifier using the href attribute instead.

accept.alternative: Use the accept attribute directly on the input elements instead.

type.alternative: These attributes do not do anything useful and for historical reasons there are no  corresponding IDL attributes on area elements. Omit them altogether.

nohref.alternative: Omitting the href attribute is sufficient; the nohref attribute is  unnecessary. Omit it altogether.

profile.alternative: When used for triggering specific user agent behaviors: use a link element  instead.

ismap.alternative: Unnecessary. Omit it altogether. All input elements with a type attribute in  the Image Button state are processed as server-side image  maps.

usemap.alternative: Use img instead of input for image maps.

longdesc.alternative: Use a regular a element to link to the description or (in the case of images) use an image map  to provide a link from the image to the image’s description.

lowsrc.alternative: Use a progressive JPEG image (given in the src attribute) instead of using two  separate images.

scheme.alternative: If more than one scheme needs to be declared for a meta element  make the scheme declaration part of the value.

codetype.alternative: Use the data and type attributes to invoke plugins. To set  parameters with these names in particular the param element can be used.

declare.alternative: Repeat the object element completely each time the resource is to be reused.

standby.alternative: Optimize the linked resource so that it loads quickly or at least incrementally.

valuetype.alternative: Use the name and value attributes without declaring value types.

for.alternative: Use DOM events mechanisms to register event listeners. [DOM41]

summary.alternative: Use one of the techniques given in the table section instead.

abbr.alternative: Use text that begins in an unambiguous and terse manner and include any more elaborate text  after that. The title attribute can also be useful in including more detailed  text so that the cell’s contents can be made terse. If it’s a heading use th (which has an abbr attribute).

axis.alternative: Use the scope attribute on the relevant th.

scope.alternative: Use th elements for heading cells.

dataformatas.alternative: Use script and a mechanism such as XMLHttpRequest to populate the page  dynamically. [XHR]
